photon.fx_object.name: Name
photon.emitter.config.duration: The duration of time (tick) the Emitter. If the system is looping, this indicates the length of one cycle.
photon.emitter.config.looping: If true, the emission cycle will repeat after the duration.
photon.emitter.config.startDelay: Delay in ticks that this Particle System will wait before emitting particles.
photon.emitter.config.startLifetime: Start lifetime in ticks, particle will die when its lifetime reaches 0.
photon.emitter.config.startSpeed: The start speed of particles, applied in the starting direction.
photon.emitter.config.startRotation: The start rotation of particles in degrees. (x-roll, y-pitch, z-yaw)
photon.emitter.config.simulationSpace: Controls whether particles are animated in the parent object’s local space (therefore moving with the parent object).
photon.emitter.config.maxParticles: The number of particles in the system will be limited by this number. Emission will be temporarily halted if this is reached.
photon.emitter.config.parallelUpdate.0: Should particles be updated in parallel threads. It will improve performance when you have massive particles. e.g., use it can improve noise calculation performance.
photon.emitter.config.parallelUpdate.1: §cThis does not always improve performance and sometimes degrade performance§r
Should particles be rendered in parallel threads. It will improve performance when you have massive particles.
§cThis does not always improve performance and sometimes degrade performance§r
e.g., enable parallel rendering under the Trail Settings can improve trail performance.
photon.emitter.config.emission: Emission of the emitter. This controls the rate at which particles are emitted as well as burst emissions.
photon.emitter.config.shape: Shape of the emitter volume, which controls where particles are emitted and their initial direction.
photon.emitter.config.renderer: Specifies how the particles are rendered.
photon.emitter.config.lights: Controls the light map of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.velocityOverLifeti: Controls the velocity of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.inheritVelocity: Controls the velocity inherited from the emitter, foreach particle.
photon.emitter.config.lifetimeByEmitterS: Controls the initial lifetime of each particle based on the speed of the emitter when the particle was spawned.
photon.emitter.config.forceOverLifetime: Controls the force of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.colorOverLifetime: Controls the color of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.colorBySpeed: Controls the color of each particle based on its speed.
photon.emitter.config.sizeOverLifetime: Controls the size of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.sizeBySpeed: Controls the size of each particle based on its speed.
photon.emitter.config.rotationOverLifeti: Controls the rotation of each particle during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.rotationBySpeed: Controls the angular velocity of each particle based on its speed.
photon.emitter.config.noise: Add noise/turbulence to particle movement. If you have many particles, you should also check parallelUpdate for better performance.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation: Particle UV animation. This allows you to specify a texture sheet (a texture with multiple tiles/subframes) and animate or randomize over it per particle.
photon.emitter.config.colorBySpeed.color: Controls the color by its speed.
photon.emitter.config.colorBySpeed.speed: Remaps speed in the defined range to a color.
Controls the color during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.emission.emissionR: The number of particles emitted per tick. The decimal part calculates the probability.
photon.emitter.config.emission.distanceR: The rate of particles emitted per meter. The decimal part calculates the probability.
photon.emitter.config.emission.emissionM: The emission mode of the decimal part, fixed interval emission or random emission.
photon.emitter.config.emission.bursts: Emission of extra particles at specific times during the duration of the system.
photon.emitter.config.emission.bursts.co: The number of particles to emit.
photon.emitter.config.emission.bursts.cy: How many times to emit the burst. (0 - repeat infinitely)
photon.emitter.config.emission.bursts.in: Repeat the burst every N ticks.
photon.emitter.config.emission.bursts.pr: 0-1 Chance that the burst will trigger.
photon.emitter.config.inheritVelocity.mo: Specifies whether the emitter velocity is inherited as a one-shot when a particle is born, always using the current emitter velocity, or using the emitter velocity when the particle was born.
photon.emitter.config.inheritVelocity.mu: Controls the amount of emitter velocity inherited during each particle's lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.lifetimeByEmitterS: Controls the initial lifetime of particles based on the speed of the emitter.
Maps the speed to a value along the curve, when using one of the curve modes.
photon.emitter.config.lights.skyLight: Sky Light value for lighting map. (0-15)
photon.emitter.config.lights.blockLight: Block Light value for lighting map. (0-15)
photon.emitter.config.noise.frequency: Low values create soft, smooth noise, and high values create rapidly changing noise.
photon.emitter.config.noise.remap: Remap the final noise values into a new range.
photon.emitter.config.noise.position: How strong the overall noise effect is. If you use a curve to set this value, the Particle System applies the curve over the lifetime of each particle.
photon.emitter.config.noise.rotation: What proportion of the noise is applied to the particle rotations,in degrees per second. If you use a curve to set this value, the Particle System applies the curve over the lifetime of each particle.
photon.emitter.config.noise.size: Multiply the size of the particle by a proportion of the noise.If you use a curve to set this value, theParticle System applies the curve over the life time of each particle.
photon.emitter.config.physics.removedWhe: Remove the particle when the collision happens.
photon.emitter.config.physics.friction: The friction of particles over lifetime. (0-infinite friction, 1-frictionless)
photon.emitter.config.physics.gravity: The gravity of particles over lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.physics.bounceChan: The possibility of bounce when it has physics.
photon.emitter.config.physics.bounceRate: The bounce rate of speed when collision happens.
photon.emitter.config.physics.bounceSpre: Addition velocity for other two axis gaussian noise when collision happens.
photon.emitter.config.renderer.renderMod: Defines the render mode of the particle renderer.
If enabled, the model will be rendered with shade for each side
If enabled, use uv according to the model, otherwise use the particle uv.
photon.emitter.config.renderer.layer: Defines the render layer of the particle renderer.
photon.emitter.config.renderer.bloomEffe: Render particles with the bloom effect.
photon.emitter.config.renderer.cull: Cull particles that are out of view.
photon.emitter.config.renderer.orderInLa: Emitter's layer within a sorted layer
photon.emitter.config.renderer.vertexSor: Whether sorting the vertex before rendering. Useful for translucent quad
photon.emitter.config.rotationBySpeed.sp: Remaps speed in the defined range to a rotation.
photon.emitter.config.sizeBySpeed.scale: Controls the scale of size by speed.
photon.emitter.config.sizeBySpeed.size: Controls the size of separated axis by speed.
photon.emitter.config.sizeBySpeed.speedR: Remaps speed in the defined range to a size.
photon.emitter.config.sizeOverLifetime.s: Controls the scale of size during its lifetime.
Controls the size of separated axis during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.trails.ratio: Choose what proportion of particles will receive a trail.
photon.emitter.config.trails.lifetime: How long each trail will last, relative to the life of the particle.
photon.emitter.config.trails.minimumVert: The minimum distance each trail can travel before adding a new vertex.
photon.emitter.config.trails.dieWithPart: The trails will disappear when their owning particles die.
photon.emitter.config.trails.uvMode: Should the U coordinate be stretched or tiled?
photon.emitter.config.trails.sizeAffects: The trails will use the particle size to control their width.
The trails will use the particle size to control their lifetime.
photon.emitter.config.trails.inheritPart: The trails will use the particle color as their base color.
photon.emitter.config.trails.colorOverLi: The color of the trails during the lifetime of the particle they are attached to.
photon.emitter.config.trails.widthOverTr: Select a width for the trail from its start to end vertex.
photon.emitter.config.trails.colorOverTr: Select a color for the trail from its start to end vertex.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation.tiles: Defines the tiling of the texture.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation.animat: Specifies the animation type: Whole Sheet or SingleRow.Whole Sheet will animate over the whole texture sheet from left to right, top to bottom. SingleRow will animate a single row in the sheet from left to right.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation.frameO: Controls the uv animation frame of each particle over its lifetime. On the horizontal axis you will find the lifetime.On the vertical axis you will find the sheet index.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation.startF: Phase the animation, so it starts on a frame other than 0.
photon.emitter.config.uvAnimation.cycle: Specifies how many times the animation will loop during the lifetime of the particle.
photon.emitter.config.velocityOverLifeti: Apply orbital velocity to particles, which will rotate them around the center of the system.
Apply an offset to the center of rotation.
Multiply the particle speed by this value.
photon.emitter.config.shape.mesh.type: Generate particles from vertices, edges or triangles.
photon.emitter.config.material.preview: Replace the material by dragging it into the preview.
photon.emitter.trail.config.time: How long the tail should be (ticks)[O, infinity].
photon.emitter.trail.config.minVertexDis: The minimum distance each trail can travel before adding a new vertex.
photon.emitter.trail.config.smoothInterp: Apply smooth interpolation to the trail.
If you enable it, increase the minVertexDistance as much as possible (We recommend greater than 0.1).
photon.emitter.trail.config.calculateSmo: If you enable it, the smooth trail will be calculated by the compute shader. Enable it when you have a massive number of tails to be smooth.
§eNOTE: §r it doesn't work with mac M-series chips.
photon.emitter.trail.config.uvMode: Should the U coordinate be stretched or tiled?
photon.emitter.trail.config.widthOverTra: Select a width for the trail from its start to end vertex.
photon.emitter.trail.config.colorOverTra: Select a color for the trail from its start to end vertex.
photon.emitter.config.sub_emitters: Sub emission of particles. This allows each particle to emit particles in another system.
photon.emitter.config.sub_emitters.emitt: Drag/Select an emitter here (using emitter name).
Inherit color from the parent particle.
Inherit size from the parent particle.
Inherit rotation from the parent particle.
Inherit age from the parent particle.
Inherit duration from the parent particle.
Determines the proportion of sub-emitter spawn events that successfully triggers the associated sub-emitter.
photon.emitter.config.additional_gpu_dat: To use it, you have to enable gpu instance, which allows to send particle's data to shader.
photon.emitter.beam.config.width: Controls the width during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.beam.config.emitRate: Controls the emit rate during its lifetime.
photon.emitter.beam.config.raycast: whether the beam's length will be reduced upon hitting an object
photon.emitter.beam.config.raycast.block: Affect how the raycast interacts with blocks.
photon.emitter.beam.config.raycast.fluid: Affect how the raycast interacts with fluids.
photon.emitter.beam.config.color: Controls the color during its lifetime.
photon.gui.editor.shape.function.tooltip: §et§r denotes the lifetime of the emitter, [0, 1)
§erandomA..E§r denotes a random value [0, 1), which has the same value in the same expression
AraTrails.space.tips: Whether to use world or local space to generate and simulate the trail.
AraTrails.customSpace.tips: Custom space to use when generating and simulating the trail
AraTrails.alignment.tips: How to align the trail geometry: facing the camera (view) of using the transform's rotation (local).
AraTrails.sorting.tips: Determines the order in which trail points will be rendered.
AraTrails.smoothness.tips: Amount of smoothing iterations applied to the trail shape.
AraTrails.highQualityCorners.tips: Calculate accurate thickness at sharp corners.
AraTrails.thicknessOverLength.tips: How should the thickness of the curve evolve over its lenght. The horizontal axis is normalized lenght (in the [0,1] range) and the vertical axis is a thickness multiplier.
AraTrails.colorOverLength.tips: How should vertex color evolve over the trail's length.
AraTrails.thicknessOverTime.tips: How should the thickness of the curve evolve with its lifetime. The horizontal axis is normalized lifetime (in the [0,1] range) and the vertical axis is a thickness multiplier.
AraTrails.colorOverTime.tips: How should vertex color evolve over the trail's lifetime.
AraTrails.initialThickness.tips: Initial thickness of trail points when they are first spawned.
AraTrails.initialColor.tips: Initial color of trail points when they are first spawned.
AraTrails.initialVelocity.tips: Initial velocity of trail points when they are first spawned.
AraTrails.minSpawnTime.tips: Minimum amount of time (in seconds) that must pass before spawning a new point.
AraTrails.minDistance.tips: Minimum distance (in meters) that must be left between consecutive points in the trail.
AraTrails.warmup.tips: Amount of seconds pre-simulated before the trail appears. Useful when you want a trail to be already simulating when the game starts.
AraTrails.inertia.tips: Amount of speed transferred from the transform to the trail. 0 means no velocity is transferred, 1 means 100% of the velocity is transferred.
AraTrails.velocitySmoothing.tips: Amount of temporal smoothing applied to the velocity transferred from the transform to the trail.
AraTrails.damping.tips: Amount of damping applied to the trail's velocity. Larger values will slow down the trail more as time passes.
AraTrails.textureMode.tips: How to apply the texture over the trail: stretch it all over its lenght, or tile it.
AraTrails.uvFactor.tips: Defines how many times are U coords repeated across the length of the trail.
AraTrails.uvWidthFactor.tips: Defines how many times are V coords repeated trough the width of the trail.
AraTrails.tileAnchor.tips: When the texture mode is set to 'Tile', defines where to begin tiling from: 0 means the start of the trail, 1 means the end.
AraTrails.section.tips: Trail cross-section asset, determines the shape of the emitted trail. If it is disabled, the trail will be a simple strip.
photon.emitter.config.prewarm: Amount of ticks pre-simulated before the first frame of rendering.
photon.emitter.config.velocityOverLifeti: Radial velocity of particles away from/towards the center position.
